intro: Scorzonera transtagana, commonly known as the Transcaucasian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Scorzonera transtagana has a taproot that can be edible, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its genus. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
